intro: Tambourissa microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved tambourissa, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features small, oval-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts.
